story:
Once upon a time, in the heart of Kenya, there was a beautiful village called Simba. In Simba, there lived a young girl named Nyambura. Nyambura was a kind and curious girl who loved exploring the savannah with her friends and learning about the world around her.

One day, Nyambura was walking through the village when she came across a small, scared bird with a broken wing. Nyambura knew that she had to help the bird, so she gently picked it up and carried it back to her hut.

Nyambura's parents were amazed by her kindness and offered to help her take care of the bird until it was strong enough to fly again. They named the bird Kioni and over the next few days, Nyambura and her family nursed Kioni back to health.

As Kioni grew stronger, Nyambura spent hours each day playing with her new friend. They would run through the fields, chase after butterflies, and sing songs together. Nyambura loved Kioni dearly and Kioni loved Nyambura just as much.

But eventually, the day came when Kioni was strong enough to fly again. Nyambura was sad to see her friend go, but she knew that Kioni was meant to be free. So, with a heavy heart, Nyambura opened the window and Kioni took to the sky.

As Kioni soared higher and higher, Nyambura couldn't help but feel a sense of pride and joy. She knew that she had helped to give her friend a second chance at life and that Kioni would always be with her in spirit.

And from that day on, Nyambura's heart was always open to helping those in need, no matter how big or small. She knew that by showing kindness and compassion, she could make a real difference in the world.

The end.

Goodnight my dear daughter, may you grow up to be as kind and compassionate as Nyambura, and always look out for those in need. Sweet dreams.
